content:
Just got this in a clash and got very confused and ended up trying to solve a different problem, where there are unlimited rounds until one or both die.

I also didn't have time to include Deathtouch, so I didn't notice that my solution would never give output "3".

It would be good to make it more clear before the note that this "at the end of combat" really just means "after each has had the chance to attack once".

Maybe also put the "<<There is only one round>>" in bold like that? This problem is a lot simpler when you realise there's only one round, but I didn't read the note in my haste to win and ended up with 37%, but came 2nd to a bot who got 75%, but the other human players struggled too. I think if it's clear it's just one chance to attack, it's a lot easier than it looks!
what is "First strike" why space here?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem, it helps the user to develop his logic.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The concept is fun and the problem is Easy to solve serving its purpose as a "Easy Puzzle" or "Fastest Mode Clash"

Interresting clash but maybe you need to add some precision about attribute (add a sentence like "a creatures could have multiple attributes) because when reading fast (and it"s a class of code so user read fast) it's not really clear.

I like the idea but the statement needs some clarification:
- Do they hit each other at the same time or does the fight end immediately when one of them dies?
- How does Deathtouch work with 0 strength?
- If a creature starts with 0 endurance, does it still get to attack?
- How long does the fight go on? Do they hit each other once, or is it a fight to the death?

I think it would also be nicer to debug if the output was something more meaningful than arbitrarily chosen integer 0/1/2/3. Maybe the remaining health or string "alive/dead" for each creature?

1) In Output section " 2 if the only the second one survives" should be "2 if only the second one survives"

2) " ≤ " this symbol can be used instead of <= . you are welcome
Thanx in advance before you're welcome :p

I've updated the statement.

About the output, for the remaining health to output, it would be necessary to define it, which I found would make the problem longer to describe.
Specified "any number of" and provided example.
It is explained in the text. What part would you like me to expand on? I am confused about the question you ask "why space" because there isn't any space in the text.
Ok, I've put "only one round" in bold. Thank you for the feedback, some things may not be obvious when you don't play card games like Magic The Gathering.
I mean there is a "Firststrike" and also there is "First strike" in some tests. and these spaced words I believe are not expected
Ah ok. Thanks for reporting, that's fixed.
